meanings.definition: To lift or move with a lever.
meanings.sent1: She levered the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He levered the door open with a crowbar.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel levered the nut up the tree using a stick.
meanings.sent4: The determined ant levered the rock out of its path.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic levered the engine into place with precision.

meanings.definition: The action of using a lever to lift or move something.
meanings.sent1: The levering of the rock required great strength.
meanings.sent2: He demonstrated the levering of the heavy machinery in the workshop.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten tried levering the toy mouse with a tiny stick.
meanings.sent4: The levering of the gate revealed a hidden garden beyond.
meanings.sent5: The levering of the seesaw made the children squeal with delight.
